user-email.label: Email
user-email.hint: Use your work address so we can confirm who you work for

reference.label: Your reference
reference.hint: We may refer to this in emails so be careful about using victims’ personal details. Use first names and not full names, for example.

user-organisation.label: Organisation
user-organisation.hint: Start typing the name of your organisation. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.

fr-location.legend: Where are you making this report?

yes.label: Yes
yes.toggle-content: You must explain to them how organisations such as the Home Office and the police will use their information.

not-sure.label: Not Sure
not-sure.toggle-content: If you’re not sure of the potential victim’s age, you will need to refer them to the relevant local authority for an age assessment. They will continue to be treated as a child until a decision on their age is made.
not-sure.toggle-content-2: You must explain to them how organisations such as the Home Office will use their information.

local-authority-contacted-about-child-lo.label: Name of local authority
local-authority-contacted-about-child-lo.hint: Start typing the local authority. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.

local-authority-contacted-about-child-lo.label: Enter phone number of local authority
Enter email address of local authority
Enter first name of local authority contact (if known)
Enter last name of local authority contact (if known)

pv-under-age-at-time-of-exploitation.legend: Were they under 18 at any time during the exploitation?

what-happened.label: Provide as much detail as you can. Do not include their name or the names of any other potential victims.
what-happened.paragraph-1: A detailed report should include information about:
what-happened.bullet-1: how the potential victim was treated
what-happened.bullet-2: what an average day was like and a description of their living conditions
what-happened.paragraph-2: If they were trafficked, it helps to know:
what-happened.bullet-3: where they were recruited and who arranged the journey
what-happened.bullet-4: details of their journey, including if they travelled with anyone

when-did-the-exploitation-take-place.label: Start and end date of exploitation

more-than-one-exploitation-situation.label: Date(s) of exploitation
more-than-one-exploitation-situation.hint: The individual should be encouraged to disclose any other periods of exploitation and the length of time, and any specific dates. This can be any form of exploitation (sexual, labour, domestic servitude) and may be of a different type to the one that initiated the referral.

how-did-the-exploitation-start.label: How they came to be exploited
how-did-the-exploitation-start.hint: Explore what promises were made, what they were expecting to do, and what pay was promised.

were-they-taken-somewhere-by-their-explo.label: Journey details
were-they-taken-somewhere-by-their-explo.hint: Include any routes, places, landmark features, or times.

what-were-they-required-to-do.label: An average day
what-were-they-required-to-do.hint: Detail what were they required to do, how many hours a day they worked and whether any breaks were allowed.

how-they-were-treated.label: Their treatment
how-they-were-treated.hint: Detail how they were treated by the person or people who exploited them, details of the accommodation and whether there was access to necessary facilities, such as bathroom, sleeping arrangements, food.

why-they-stayed.label: Why they stayed
why-they-stayed.hint: Explain whether they were forcibly detained, whether threats, force or coercion were used against them, whether their documents were removed from them.

how-why-did-they-leave-the-situation.label: How and why they left
how-why-did-they-leave-the-situation.hint: Ask if it was their decision to leave and if anyone helped them.

when-last-contact.legend: When were the potential victim and exploiters last in contact?
when-last-contact.hint: This includes in person conversations, phone calls, instant messages, emails, writing, or communicating through another person

details-last-contact.label: Details of last contact (optional)
details-last-contact.hint: You can email any files as evidence to us after you have submitted the report

is-this-the-first-chance-to-report.legend: Is this the first chance they have had to report this?

why-report-now.label: Is there anything that prevented the potential victim from reporting this sooner?

where-how-interview-carried-out.label: Details about the interview
where-how-interview-carried-out.hint: Include whether they needed to take breaks (and why), the number of sessions over which the interview took place and whether there were any safeguarding concerns.

are-others-involved-details.label: Other people involved
are-others-involved-details.hint: Include any referrals made, actions already taken, reference numbers, or contact details

whats-their-background.label: What is their background?
whats-their-background.bullet-1: where they were born (town or village)
whats-their-background.bullet-3: their education and what they did after leaving school
whats-their-background.bullet-4: details of their journey, including if they travelled with anyone

education.label: Education and what they did after leaving school

where-exploitation-happened.legend: Where was the potential victim exploited?

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-1.label: Select city or town (Type Unknown if they are unsure)
where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-1.hint: Start typing the city. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-2.label: Select a second city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-3.label: Select a third city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-4.label: Select a fourth city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-5.label: Select a fifth city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-6.label: Select a sixth city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-7.label: Select a seventh city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-8.label: Select an eighth city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-9.label: Select a ninth city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-uk-city-10.label: Select a tenth city or town (Optional)

where-exploitation-happened-other-uk-oth.label: Address or location
where-exploitation-happened-other-uk-oth.hint: Provide any addresses, locations or other details that may help us identify the location of the exploitation(s).

where-exploitation-happened-overseas-cou.label: Select country (Type Unknown if they are unsure)
where-exploitation-happened-overseas-cou.hint: Start typing the country. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.

where-exploitation-happened-other-overse.label: Address or location
where-exploitation-happened-other-overse.hint: Provide any addresses, locations or other details that may help us identify the location of the exploitation(s).

who-exploited-pv.label: Details about the exploiter(s)
who-exploited-pv.hint: Include the languages the exploiters spoke, their gang or nicknames and if they had identifying features such as tattoos.

exploiters-location.legend: Do you have information about where the exploiters are?
exploiters-location.hint: Provide any information you can, even if you think it is outdated

are-exploiters-in-the-uk.legend: Are the exploiters in the UK?
are-exploiters-in-the-uk.hint: If you are unsure, answer based on the last known location of the exploiters

exploiters-current-location-details.label: Information about the exploiters' location
exploiters-current-location-details.hint: This can be a general or specific location, or even a contact from another organisation who has this information.

types-of-exploitation-forced-to-work.label: Forced to work for nothing or almost nothing
types-of-exploitation-forced-to-work.hint: Victims may live in isolated areas or poor conditions, such as in squats or at their place of work. They may be unable to leave and threatened with violence.

types-of-exploitation-wages-taken.label: Wages taken by force or coercion, such as through control of a bank account

types-of-exploitation-forced-to-commit-f.label: Forced to commit fraud, such as using their identity to claim benefits

types-of-exploitation-taken-somewhere.label: Taken somewhere, held against their will and sexually assaulted

types-of-exploitation-forced-to-commit-c.label: Forced to commit a crime, such as growing cannabis, drug dealing or begging
types-of-exploitation-forced-to-commit-c.hint: This includes being used as a drug mule across county lines. Victims will often be unpaid although they may get food and somewhere to live.

types-of-exploitation-organs-removed.label: Organs, such as kidneys, removed against their will

types-of-exploitation-unpaid-household-w.label: Forced to do unpaid or low paid household work by relatives or strangers
types-of-exploitation-unpaid-household-w.hint: Victims who are exploited by relatives may have been forced into an arranged marriage and abused in other ways.

any-other-pvs.legend: Were there any other potential victims?

other-potential-victims-yes-details.label: Provide more information (optional)
other-potential-victims-yes-details.hint: If you know them, include any operation names or family members being reported at the same time.

other-potential-victims-not-sure-details.label: Provide more information (optional)
other-potential-victims-not-sure-details.hint: If you know them, include any operation names or family members being reported at the same time.

future-exploitation-concerns.legend: Are there concerns that the potential victim could be exploited again in the future?
future-exploitation-concerns.hint: This includes concerns from other professionals or organisations involved. You must have reasons or evidence for these concerns

future-exploitation-reasons.label: Explain why there are concerns
future-exploitation-reasons.hint: If you have file-based evidence, this can be sent to us once the report is submitted

reported-to-police.legend: Do they have a crime reference number related to any reported Modern Slavery crime, in which they are a victim?

reported-to-police-police-forces.label: Select police force
reported-to-police-police-forces.hint: Start typing the police force. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.

authorities-cooperation.legend: Is the potential victim willing to help with investigations or criminal proceedings into their exploitation?
authorities-cooperation.hint: If you are unsure, save your progress and check with them

authorities-cooperation-details.label: Details of co-operation with authorities
authorities-cooperation-details.hint: Details about the individual’s existing or planned co-operation (optional)

pv-want-to-submit-nrm.legend: Do they have a crime reference number?
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.paragraph-1: If a potential victim wants you to refer their case, they can get:
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.bullet-1: access to support (for example, housing and legal advice)
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.bullet-2: a formal decision – this can help if they’re being prosecuted for a crime they were forced to commit
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.pv-guidance-explained-a: make sure that the potential victim understands by entering the NRM they are consenting to a reasonable grounds and conclusive grounds decision being made
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.pv-guidance-explained-b: make sure that the potential victim understands the support that they may be able to receive, as detailed in the guidance (see section 'Support for Adult Victims'). This may require the assistance of an appropriate interpreter.
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.pv-guidance-explained-c: explain to the potential victim the ways in which the Home Office may process their personal information, including the purposes for which it will be used, the legal basis and who it will be shared with. You can find this information in the This is contained in the Privacy Information Notice and Personal Information Charter.
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.automatic-referral: As the potential victim is either under 18 years old, or their age is unknown, their consent is not required for the case to be referred.
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.automatic-referral-div-1-paragraph-1: We will need to share their personal details with organisations such as the police and the Home Office.
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.automatic-referral-div-1-paragraph-2: If appropriate please explain to the potential victim the ways in which the Home Office may process their personal information, including the purposes for which it will be used, the legal basis and who it will be shared with. This is contained in the Privacy Information Notice and Personal Information Charter.

yes.label: Yes - I have explained this to the potential victim along with the Privacy Information Notice and they give consent for me to refer their case.

no.label: No – I have explained this to the potential victim and they do not give consent for me to refer their case. They understand this means their case will not be referred to the NRM and they will not receive support or a formal decision.

refuse-nrm.label: Briefly explain why the potential victim doesn't want their case referred

does-pv-need-support.legend: Does the potential victim want support?

pv-phone-number.legend: How can the support provider contact the potential victim?

no-contact-details.label: If the potential victim wants to receive support and does not have a telephone number, you can nd who it will be shared with. This is contained in the contact the support provider (opens in new tab) for them.

pv-name-nickname.label: Nickname or name used during exploitation (Optional)

unknown.label: They do not identify as male or female

pv-nationality.label: Select nationality
pv-nationality.hint: Start typing the nationality. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.

pv-nationality-second.label: Select second nationality (Optional)
pv-nationality-second.hint: Start typing the country. It must appear on the list for you to be able to continue.
pv-nationality-second.summary-text: Select a second nationality for dual nationals

pv-other-help-with-communication.legend: Do they need help with communication?
pv-other-help-with-communication.hint: For example, a hearing aid or a sign language interpreter.

pv-ho-reference.legend: Do they have any Home Office references?
pv-ho-reference.hint: For example, a Home Office visa application or port reference

pv-ho-reference-type.label: Enter type of reference, reference number or both

someone-else-permission-check.label: The potential victim has given you permission to send the decision to this person.

email.label: Email
email.hint: Only enter an email address that is specific to the potential victim

pv-contact-details-email-check.label: It is safe to write to them here

pv-contact-details-post-check.label: It is safe to write to them here

fr-alternative-contact.label: Email address
fr-alternative-contact.hint: This could be a manager, colleague or a team inbox.
